doc.after: A mixed state cannot be described as a ket vector. Instead, it is described by its associated density matrix (or density operator), usually denoted Ï. Note that density matrices can describe both mixed and pure states, treating them on the same footing. Moreover, a mixed quantum state on a given quantum system described by a Hilbert space can be always represented as the partial trace of a pure quantum state (called a purification) on a larger bipartite system for a sufficiently large Hilbert space .
